item.title: Pest control PI
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

Jmood:

just having void means the method can only be called with in that class as far as I know, static allows the method to be called through out the entire program.

would it just be

public static void spawnNpcs() { Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6142,2628,2591,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6143,2680,2588,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6144,2669,2570,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6145,2645,2569,0,0,200,0,0,100); }

Read full topic

item.title: Pest control PI
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:5, topic:444119”]If you read the error you would see you’re calling a non-static method from a static context.

So public void Hello cannot be called from another class unless you add static. Public static void Hello would work.[/quote]

Does static void and just void make a big difference? If so, how?

Read full topic

item.title: Pest control PI
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If you read the error you would see you’re calling a non-static method from a static context.

So public void Hello cannot be called from another class unless you add static. Public static void Hello would work.

Read full topic

item.title: Pest control PI
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

That is the error I get, but how should I rewrite this part:

Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6142,2628,2591,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6143,2680,2588,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6144,2669,2570,0,0,200,0,0,100); Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc2(6145,2645,2569,0,0,200,0,0,100);

So that it doesn’t give me this error? Thank you!

Read full topic
